1.title: Episode #8.1
1.plot: Ten Swedish-settled Americans come to Sweden to look for their roots. Only one of them will win the prize - a family reunion with his Swedish family. The adventure begins at high speed and the participants arrive at Helsingborg. On site in Sweden, the pursuit of their Swedish history begins. Three new friends appear to have connections to Helsingborg.

2.title: Episode #8.2
2.plot: The summer has just begun for the Americans in Everything for Sweden. Now they come to Skövde and end up at the school bench. They will live like Swedish high school students, it will not just be a plug, the Americans will be able to party too. Andrew Morrisson and Kyle Johnsson come one step closer to the truth about their Swedish roots. Their family stories are unexpectedly linked. It will be a tremendous farewell when the first American is forced to leave Everything for Sweden.

3.title: Episode #8.3
3.plot: In Alfta in Hälsingland, they will live as their Swedish ancestors, 19th century life in a Hälsingegård. The time trip is complete with tiring woodwork, food over open fire and unusual hay beds. One of the participants turns out to have strong links with the place, her ancestor created history in Hälsingland. Anders Lundin brings up emotions when he reveals Swedish relations to the church.

4.title: Episode #8.4
4.plot: The Americans fly to Norrland. In the wilderness outside Älvsbyn they will be camping. The participants are not entirely focused, the question is how well they will manage in the forest. The Northern-born nature turns out to be both touching and upset. Americans dare on a very dangerous jump. Anders Lundin holds a vital lesson about Sweden and Switzerland. The racing event takes place on the railroad, after all, everyone will not be allowed to fight for a family reunion with their Swedish family.

5.title: Episode #8.5
5.plot: The Americans come to Vimmerby and will discover Astrid Lindgren's fairytale world. They learn why these stories have such a great place in our Swedish hearts. And then they will move into Emil in Lönneberga's farm Katthult where they will live as the family in the saga. Some of them will end up in the snowboarder. Anders Lundin teaches them about the dark story behind our Saturday goddess.

6.title: Episode #8.6
6.plot: On Sweden's national day, the Americans come to Stockholm. They will move into two Swedish immigrant families, families forced to make the same trip as the American ancestors of Sweden. The national day is celebrated with the families where Swedish traditions meet Somali and Arabic. Anders Lundin reveals the lies in Donald Trump's statements about Sweden. And so, the Americans will compete. Questions about the phenomenon Abba determine who can continue the adventure.

7.title: Episode #8.7
7.plot: It's time for Americans to take a vacation. They sail into the archipelago of Landsort. There will be a cultural crunch when Americans go to the islanders to eat dinner. They can also try to drive a pilot boat and discover Sweden's oldest guy. Anders Lundin is set against the wall when the Americans have a lot of questions about Swedes' behavior. The final is approaching but everyone will not get there all the way.

8.title: Episode #8.8
8.plot: The summer in Sweden is nearing its end and it's time for the final. Four Americans have gone all the way to Norrköping where it will be decided who wins. Three competitions stand between the Americans and the big prize: a family reunion with its Swedish family.

1.title: Episode #3.1
1.plot: Part 1 of 8. Ten Swedish-Americans going to Sweden to experience the country in which they are rooted. The adventure begins at the airport, where the Americans get one, to say the least, emotional surprise. Some of them are big ABBA fans and are overjoyed when they visit the New Museum on Djurgården. Rebecca Redner, housewife from Texas with roots in Stockholm, the answer to the question she has carried with him since childhood: Is she related to the Swedish royal family? Hostess is Anders Lundin.

2.title: Episode #3.2
2.plot: Swedish-Americans are going to Söderköping to taste the life of their relatives lived in the 1800s. Then it was relatively common crow was on the menu and they are shocked when they are told that they should also prepare this dish. Shane Booth learns that a stolen bag of horseshoes was the basis for his ancestor emigrated for over a hundred years ago. There has also been time for the first American to leave "Everything for Sweden" in the season's first knockout competition.

3.title: Episode #3.3
3.plot: Americans traveling on a boat at the Swedish blue ribbon, the canal. It will dramatically when they sluiced until Motala, where they are going to celebrate the Swedish National Day. Dawn Anderson knows all about her Korean origin, but nothing about his Swedish She may now know why she has such strong connections to the construction of the canal. The nine Americans become eight when another has to leave the program.

4.title: Episode #3.4
4.plot: Swedish reality series from 2013. Americans come to Gothenburg and learn all about how modern Swedish families live. Family Father and Cowboy Michael Peterson from Texas does not have a good relationship with their father. Michael learns how family relationships have looked like before the family emigrated. And so it becomes a bit of Göteborg humor of course. But less fun it will be when even one American to leave the program.

5.title: Episode #3.5
5.plot: Swedish reality series from 2013. Americans go on dance tour in Värmland belt Donnez. The barn dance hits-regulars who teaches them to bug and gnussa. In Värmland village Segerstad, John Stenson's roots. He is Swedish on her father's side and finally get answers as to why the family was forced to leave Sweden. It will be an emotional experience for John. Yet Americans must leave everything to Sweden after a thrilling duel involving hockey legend Hakan Loob.

6.title: Episode #3.6
6.plot: The Americans arrive in the heart of Sweden? Mora in Dalarna. For most Americans, it is not the Swedish flag that is our greatest national symbol, but the Dala horse. Therefore, it becomes a very powerful experience when Americans get to visit dalahäst factory in Nusnäs and additionally make their very own wooden horse. Matthew Anderson's family comes from Mora and he has been waiting all summer to get to know their family history. The result allowed him to understand why his father is who he is. Dala horse plays another important role when another American must leave...

7.title: Episode #3.7
7.plot: Swedish reality series from 2013. Now begins the time in Sweden coming to an end. It's only five Americans left. On Gotland waiting that all Swedes are going there to do - have a great holiday! Americans visiting Sweden's hottest beach and cars around on the historic island. It gets strong reactions when Americans see how unabashed and naked Swedes behave on holiday. Lori Ferguson is Swedish for grandmother and grandfather's side. It was they who got Lori to love Sweden and the Swedish origin. Now she will find out what happened when her grandfather's relatives ...

8.title: Episode #3.8
8.plot: Swedish reality series from 2013. Final. Now it will be decided which of the Americans to win a reunion with his Swedish relatives. This is determined through three contests, where one by one knocked out and in the end only the winner remains. The price - the reunion - then becomes a very emotional story.

1.title: Episode #4.1
1.plot: The Americans are coming in over the Öresund Bridge and arrive Malmö. There will be strong emotions at once, when all Americans get a least-awaited surprise.

2.title: Episode #4.2
2.plot: Americans traveling to Småland Pjätteryd. There, they run a farm in the same way as their Swedish ancestors did before they emigrated. Ingvar Kamprad grew up in a village near the farm and Kamprad found to have links to one of the Americans.

3.title: Episode #4.3
3.plot: The journey has taken the Swedish-Americans to Gävle. There, they try to find out what really set fire to Christmas goat. Fire plays a dramatic role in Gävle history. And Courtney Schlagel, Texas, learns how difficult Gävle urban fires affected her relatives.

4.title: Episode #4.4
4.plot: And now they have come to Uppsala and move into two so-called star-families. One family has 15 children, and in the second family is a mother who is single, she chose to have children with a Danish donor. But none of the Americans want to share a bedroom with Nate who may take matters into their own hands.

5.title: Episode #4.5
5.plot: Seven Swedish Americans are still fighting about the price, a family reunion with his Swedish relatives. This week we journey to Kiruna. Already on the planet happens to Americans encounter on the city's legendary hockey player Borje Salming. The herdsman Helena bring Americans up the mountain.

6.title: Episode #4.6
6.plot: Swedish-Americans are going to Nyköping and there is ongoing folkrace. Americans incur bilmeckaroveraller and shows folkracande families with their beloved cars. Nate Butler who is Indian, very much about the Indian origin but knows nothing of his Swedish relatives. Now, he finally answers to the mystery surrounding the emigrant who moved the family from the Swedish west coast to the US West Coast.

7.title: Episode #4.7
7.plot: The Americans will try a Swedish summer tradition - island hopping in Stockholm's archipelago. There will be holiday on a picturesque island in the archipelago, but in tents. Something as atmospheric as a fishing trip in a rowing boat will determine which team goes to the finals, and who ends up in the rough casting contest. Five Swedish-Americans still struggling to win a family reunion with his Swedish relatives.

8.title: Episode #4.8
8.plot: Four Swedish-Americans have taken it all the way from Malmö in the south, via Kiruna in the north and up to the capital of Sweden, where it is time for the final. Now it becomes clear who the Americans will win a reunion with his Swedish relatives. The final is decided in three competitions, where one by one turned out. Who will win the price determined in the historic courtroom for the Nobel Banquet - Blue Hall. The price, the reunion, is a moving story.

1.title: Episode #5.1
1.plot: In the first section arrives our Americans to Grassland in Värmland, where a crash course in the Swedish coffee culture and Swedish food habits are on the schedule.

2.title: Episode #5.2
2.plot: Tonight they come to Linköping, where they get to experience a piece bygone Sweden. 1800's of enthusiast James Morgan finds something he searched long after he finds out his family's sad story.

3.title: Episode #5.3
3.plot: This week steered the ship to the former Swedish Aland Islands. Where they may in particular consider the real Finnish tango and even learn why Åland is Finnish. Kurt Engstrom get a deeper insight into its origin.

4.title: Episode #5.4
4.plot: Nine Swedish descendants remain in search of their lost ancestors. After a quick visit Åland are back on Swedish soil, and this time in our royal army service. They'll try military life, and Jamie Lystra also get insights into their family's origins. In the races happen Swedish-Americans from dangerous flirted lieutenants and huge bombs.

5.title: Episode #5.5
5.plot: Of the eleven Swedish descendants who started the journey, now remain eight. In the evening they stop to Strangnas, where they move into the two common, Swedish families. Where they may in particular experiencing the start of the Swedish summer: graduation. Moreover, Beverly Wassberg finally his family treasure. In the races subjected our Americans among other things, a bit special variant of rounders.

6.title: Episode #5.6
6.plot: Seven Swedish Americans remain in the hunt for his lost family. Tonight, the journey to Stockholm, where they get to experience what some consider to be the Decade celebration: Prince wedding. Alexis will finally find out the secret behind her noble ancestor emigration, and Beverly and Charles are inspired by wedding fever. The races are offered, among other things, in a thrilling jousting.

1.title: Episode #6.1
1.plot: Now it's time for ten Swedish-Americans to experience Sweden - the country where they have their roots. But only one gets the chance of a grand family reunion. This year Americans arrive in Sweden with an old schooner bound for the port of Gothenburg. A reverse route toward their ancestral journey of over a century ago. The Americans take the train to Dalsland where they move into an ordinary residential neighborhood where they will celebrate Mother's Day with sandwich cake.

2.title: Episode #6.2
2.plot: The Americans are in the Falkirk area, and will try to live as most Swedes in rural areas did during the 1800s. Some live and work the big farmers and some of the poorest of the poor; crofter.

3.title: Episode #6.3
3.plot: The Americans open the trunk in Stockholm and are overjoyed for them to be able to go to Håkan Hellströms hometown of Gothenburg. They jump on a tour bus and is joined by some HH fans who teaches them all they can about Håkan.

4.title: Episode #6.4
4.plot: Swedish-Americans coming to beautiful Österlen, where they get to experience Swedish gastronomy. On a 1600-century farmhouse in Drakamöllans reserve the Swedish laws slow food. Anders also get the opportunity to teach Americans about how the Swedes invented racism - a dark part of the history of Sweden. At the end of the program, the Ale stones that stands as the scene of rash race where a third participant must submit all of Sweden.

5.title: Episode #6.5
5.plot: The Americans must know that it is time to leave Sweden. They'll go over the Sound and stay with Swedes who have chosen to settle in Denmark. In Denmark, the Americans see how much difference there can be between two people living so close together and have so much in common. Anders teach Americans why the Swedes irritates the Danes so much, and in a competition revived outrage match at Parken in 2007. In addition, another participant leaving the program - with a bang. Host: Anders Lundin.

6.title: Episode #6.6
6.plot: So it is time for the Swedish-Americans to live like their ancestors the Vikings. They will be picked up by our Swedish Vikings E-Type and row out to Birka, where they participate in a fertilitetsrit and bathed in the bright summer evening.

7.title: Episode #6.7
7.plot: Swedish-Americans attracts Stöde in Medelpad on the road trip. It tests the hiring a man from the neighborhood. The guys hang out with the local original Håkki. And the girls follow with Dan and Irene in their motor home.

8.title: Episode #6.8
8.plot: It is time for the season finale and it is set in the picturesque village Wira Mill in Roslagen. Of the ten Americans who came to Sweden to look their Swedish roots are now only four remain, and one by one will be knocked out in three rounds before the finale. Whoever wins the final, final, the competition is the one who gets the grand prize, a big family reunion with his Swedish relatives.

1.title: Episode #7.1
1.plot: Ten new Swedish-Americans are ready to discover Sweden. Among the participants of the year is a musical artist who recently debuted on Broadway, a yoga instructor who converted to Sikhism and a Vietnam veteran who supplies himself as a blower.

2.title: Episode #7.2
2.plot: After a lightning in the town of Nora in Bergslagen, Americans can jump on an old steam locomotive and go to Sweden's oldest railway down to the Old Pershyttan. They will try out life as mountain men and the mountain men in Pershyttan were the foundation of Sweden's prosperity. The Americans quickly realize that there was no easy life they lived in the past. They live at a Bergsmansgård, live, eat and work just like in the past.

3.title: Episode #7.3
3.plot: It is June 6th and the Americans have come to Stockholm to celebrate Sweden's national day. Anders Lundin teaches them what the word means, and they quickly notice that in Sweden, the national day celebration also applies. The day of glory, the Americans dress in classic Swedish landscape costume belonging to the landscapes their ancestors came from. The participants celebrate the day at Skansen with games from the past, and some of them even succeed in capturing the attention of the King and Queen.

4.title: Episode #7.4
4.plot: Around 600,000 Swedes sing in a row and in Sundsvall the Americans can sing in two different choirs. Half the gang moves in with the driver, Rigmor Berglund, who leads the choir Tritonus, while the other half is living with Pontus Lindström, member of Kjell Lönnås Kammarkör. It will be an overwhelming experience for Americans and strong feelings when not only one, but two participants eventually have to leave Everything for Sweden.

5.title: Episode #7.5
5.plot: In Härnösand, Americans try the Svensson life. Half the gang is allowed to work at the municipality's circuit park, where they learn that Swedish people are better able to handle themselves. The rest of the participants may work at the Employment Service. No working week is complete without Friday. It will be tacos and on the track with the work colleagues. Anders Lundin gets the Americans genuinely shy when Swedish school this time is about Swedish sin.

6.title: Episode #7.6
6.plot: Part 6 of 8. The Americans move into the castle Torpa stone house and are thus moved to the 16th century and can live castle life in contemporary clothes. They also learn to fight with swords and celebrate like royalty from before. One of the Americans may also sleep in Gustav Vasa's old bed. The castle is said to be one of the most haunted in Sweden, and the Americans enthusiastically play ghost hunting. Program leader is Anders Lundin.

7.title: Episode #7.7
7.plot: Our Americans go out to a true Swedish camping champion. By car and caravan they go out on the Swedish roads and camps in Malmköping. The Americans get to know their campers and grill, swim, play kubb and do all that belong to the Swedish summer holiday.

8.title: Episode #7.8
8.plot: The season end takes our four finalists to Vadstena. There will be a tough and even match in three different competitions. It will be a heavy start for one of the Americans, who suffer from a lot of sadness. Strong feelings await participants who share their personal experiences in Sweden during the classic meatball afternoon. For our winner, a moving family meeting is waiting.

imdb.plot outline: Everything for Sweden is a Swedish reality series which premiered in Swedish Television on 30 October 2011. Filming of season 1 took place in June 2011. The series is based on the popular Norwegian TV show Alt for Norge from TVNorge. The series is about Swedish-Americans returning to Sweden to discover their roots. In the program, they learn more about their family. Each week forced a participant in leaving the series and can thus miss their chance to get to know more about its origins. Host is Anders Lundin. In each section, participants puzzle pieces that will make their family complete map. Genealogists for the series is Helena Stark.
